metadata.description: provide the name of the solution
Choose the deployment type of your solution
Select YES/NO to deploy Api Management Service to provide security to function App.It also cost effective.
Choose the location where resources to be deployed
Choose location for OMS Log Analytics
specify the region for application insights
provide the user name for the SQL server, please make a note of Username this will be used further
provide the password for the SQL server, make a note of the Password this will be used further
Please provide Tenant Id of the subscription. This will be used to authenticate the Azure account while deploying the automation account
please provide the Application clientID
provide the Application Client Secret
provide the Application object ID
azure portal login username
azure portal login password
Here we need to provide the immediate day/time gap between the deployment start and completion time in the place of signedExpiry
Provide the guid prefix for the runbook job to be created. Generate using https://www.guidgenerator.com/online-guid-generator.aspx
Please use the cosmosdb module which placed under /code folder by placing it in any public storage
please provide the Azure AD Preview module which placed under /code folder by placing it in any public storage
Please use function app build file url here which is in public storage
Please use web app build file url here which is in public storage
Please use the sql bacpac file which placed under /scripts folder by placing it in any public storage
String used as a base for naming resources (6 alphanumeric characters or less).  A unique hash is prepended to the string for some resources, while resource-specific information is appended.
Authorization type for SSH access to VMs
Administrator username of each deployed VM (alphanumeric characters only)
Administrator password for each deployed VM
SSH RSA public key file as a string
If 1, use specified IP address/subnet to restrict access to all endpoints.  If 0, access is open to any IP address.
If restrictAccess is set to 1, specify an individual IP address or IP subnet/address range here from where access to all endpoints will be allowed.
Number of mining nodes to create for each consortium member.If you choose deployment type as Standard (or)Premium make the default value as 2
Number of mining nodes to create for each consortium member.
Number of mining nodes to create for each consortium member.
Storage performance level for virtual machines
Size of the virtual machine used for mining nodes
In a multi-member setup, each member should have a unique value to ensure they can connect
Password used to secure the Ethereum accounts that will be generated
Password used to generate the private keys associated with the Ethereum accounts that are generated.  Consider a password with sufficient randomness to ensure a strong private key
Private Ethereum network ID to which to connect (max 9 digit number)
The base URL for dependent assets
